register.title: Profile
register.description: This register defines how the product is seen by the hosts: USB or BLE profile, primary interface, primary communication protocol. It implicitly activates either [Operating mode](../../../Introduction/Operating_Modes).

option.title: SpringProx Legacy mode, Serial or CDC
Smart Reader mode, Serial or CDC
ST UHF reader host protocol, Serial or CDC
NXP NFC Cockpit host protocol, Serial or CDC

register.title: USB options
register.description: Control various options related to the USB interface.
register.remark: If the product has no USB interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: USB is disabled, all the other settings are ignored
The actual serial number of the product is provided in the USB descriptor
A constant serial number is provided in the USB descriptor

field.title: On USB bus reset event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus reset
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: On USB bus resume event, does the product fully reset?
field.name: Reset on bus resume
field.remark: Standard behaviour is no, but this does help putting back a battery-powered or externaly-powered product that was connected through Bluetooth or Network to the 'ready for USB operation' state

field.title: Disable SpringCore direct as secondary USB interface.
field.name: No Direct
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `0` (SpringCore Direct only), this setting is ignored.

option.title: SpringCore Direct is announced in the USB profile
SpringCore Direct is not announced in the USB profile

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost and the product is not allowed to keep running
field.name: VBUS down stop action

field.title: Behaviour of the product when USB VBUS is lost
field.name: VBUS down behaviour

option.title: Keep running (either on external power or battery)

register.title: BLE options
register.description: Control various options related to the BLE interface.
register.remark: If the product has no BLE interface, this register is ignored.

option.title: BLE is disabled, all the other settings are ignored

field.title: Disable BLE negociation (use default settings and avoid renegociation).
field.name: Disable negociation

field.title: Use a different address (BT_ADDR) per profile
field.name: Addr per profile

option.title: Une the same BT_ADDR whatever the profile
The first bits of the BT_ADDR change with the profile

field.title: Defines whether the BLE interface requires paired (bonded) connections, or not.
field.name: Force pairing
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `3` (HID only), this entry MUST be set to 1 for correct operation with the iOS and Android operating systems.

option.title: No pairing required - The BLE profile exposes only unbonded services
Force pairing - The BLE profile exposes only bonded services

field.title: Disable SpringCore direct as secondary BLE interface.
field.name: No Direct
field.remark: If [Primary profile](Profile) is set to `0` (SpringCore Direct only), this setting is ignored.

option.title: SpringCore Direct is announced in the BLE profile
SpringCore Direct is not announced in the BLE profile

field.title: Defines how the BLE interface is used.
field.name: Role

option.title: Device; use the BLE interface to communicate with the host.
Reader; use the BLE interface to read BLE tokens. Use [BLE template](../../Templates/BLE_template) to configure Smart Reader operation with BLE tokens.
Beacon; use the BLE interface for iBeacon brodcasting.

register.title: Profile addons
register.description: Control various options related to the current profile.

field.title: Enable HID Ringer addon used by Telephony services (experimental).
field.name: Enable Ringer

register.title: Battery configuration
register.description: When the product has a battery, this register controls the behaviour of the power button and the power-saving policy.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have a battery.

option.title: The product can not use 1A mode.
The product detects and selects LOW or HIGH charge mode.
The product forces HIGH charge mode.
The product can't sleep when connected to a charger.
The product can sleep when connected to a charger.

field.title: Wake up provided by the BLE chip
field.name: Wake up from BGM

option.title: The product can't be wake up by the BLE chip.
The product can be wake up by the BLE chip.
The product stops immediately when the external power supply is unplugged
The power button must be pressed to stop the product
The product starts immediately when an external power supply is plugged
The power button must be pressed to start the product

field.title: Power saving delay, unconnected
field.name: Power saving unconnected
field.description: Number of minutes before shutting down, when the product is running on battery and is not connected to a remote host.
field.remark: Default is 3 minutes.

field.title: Power saving delay, connected but idle
field.name: Power saving connected
field.description: Number of minutes before shutting down, when the product is running on battery and is connected to a remote host, but the remote host does not send any command to the product.
field.remark: Disabled by default (the product remains powered as long as the remote host is connected).

register.title: Trace level
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Trace options
register.remark: This register is available only in debug builds of the firmware.

register.title: Application name
register.description: This register is available to store the name of application or to identify the integrator who has loaded its license in the product. See the [license cryptogram](License_cryptogram) paragraph for details.

register.title: Global UI options
register.description: This register control global UI behaviour.

register.title: Options for the main 4-LED ramp
register.description: For products that have a set of 4 LEDs as primary user interface, this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product's primary UI is an [RGB LED](RGB_LED).

register.title: Settings for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register defines its color and behaviour.

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is active, waiting for a card
field.name: State

field.title: Color of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: Color

field.title: State of the RGB LED(s) when the product is inactive
field.name: State

register.title: Light level for the main RGB LED(s)
register.description: For products that have a RGB LED (or a set of RGB LEDs) as primary user interface, this register control the light level.

field.title: Light level when active
field.name: Full-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 100%.

field.title: Light level when idle
field.name: Dimmed-level luminosity
field.remark: Value is in percent (0-100%). Default is 75%.

field.title: Delay before switching to dimmed-level luminosity.
field.name: Dimm after
field.remark: Value is in seconds. Default is 10s. Set to 0 to prevent dimming the light.

register.title: Options for the auxiliary LEDs
register.description: For products that have auxiliary LEDs (for instance to show the state of the Bluetooth connection or the battery level), this register control their behaviour.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have any auxiliary LED.

register.title: Sound options
register.description: Options for the single-tone beeper (aka buzzer) or volume for the enhanced sound driver.
register.remark: This register is ignored if the product does not have a buzzer nor an enhanced sound driver.

field.title: Control whether the product is allowed to beep or define the Volume level. Set to 0 to disable sound. The maximum volume level depends on the product type.
field.name: Volume

register.title: Product Specific
register.description: Custom UI options for specific products.

register.title: Theme selection
register.description: Select which them to use for the UI .

node.title: Configuration for Smart Reader operation
node.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

register.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
register.title: Smart Reader features
register.description: Key settings for Smart Reader operation

field.title: Insert / Remove
field.name: Insert Remove
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: The Smart Reader sends the Tag read event only
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: The Smart Reader sends the Tag inserted event when the tag arrives, and the Tag removed event when it has leaved
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Explicit activation
field.name: Explicit activation
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation is activated automatically as soon as a host is connected
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation has to be activated explicitly by a command from the host
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Activate on startup
field.name: Activate on startup
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation has to be activated
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: Smart Reader operation is activated as soon as the product starts up
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output protocol over a serial link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select MK1 for compatibility with earlier K663/RDR, S663/RDR etc.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.title: Output protocol over a Bluetooth link
field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select TLV for operation with SpringCard's iOS and Android reference applications.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

field.name: Protocol
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Select TLV for operation with SpringCard Companion.

option.title: TLV
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: SCRDR
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: JSON
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

option.title: MK1
option.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4

register.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
register.title: Smart Reader timings
register.description: Key timings for Smart Reader operation
register.remark: All the timings are specified in tenth of seconds. Normal values go from 1 (100ms) to 254 (25.4s). Value 0 stands for as quickly as possible.

field.title: Delay between 2 consecutive readings
field.name: Read interval
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Value is specified in 10th of second. Increase this value if the host is too slow to process 2 Tags in a raw.

field.title: Delay before reading the same Tag again
field.name: Repeat interval
field.visibleif: REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4
field.remark: Value is specified in 10th of second. Set this value to 255 to force a Tag removal before repeating the same Tag.

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Keyboard layout
register.description: Defines the layout of the keyboard when the product runs in keyboard-emulation mode (HID over USB or HID over BLE).

field.title: Keyboard layout
field.name: Keyboard layout
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
field.description: Defines the layout of the keyboard when the product runs in keyboard-emulation mode (HID over USB or HID over BLE).

option.title: US, QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French, AZERTY, complete (with num. padd)
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: German, QWERTZ
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French, AZERTY, laptop (no num. padd)
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: English (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: French (extended), AZERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: German (extended), QWERTZ
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Spanish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Italian (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Japanese (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Swedish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

option.title: Polish (extended), QWERTY
option.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)
register.title: Misc. options when running in keyboard mode

field.title: Misc. options when running in keyboard mode
field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

field.visibleif: (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 0 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3 or REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 4) and (REGBITS(0x02C0, 0, 3) is 3)

register.title: Access Conditions to configuration & firmware update

option.title: The Load Factory Config hardware button or sequence (if some) is enabled
The Load Factory Config hardware button or sequence (if some) is disabled
Master Cards may write (private) keys in the ATECC
Master Cards have no access to the ATECC

field.title: Master Cards access to SAM AV
field.name: SAMAV Master Cards

option.title: Master Cards may write (secret) keys in the SAM AV
Master Cards have no access to the SAM AV
Master Cards are enabled without restriction
Master Cards are enabled only during 2 seconds after power up
The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Local host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions
The firmware can be upgraded with no restriction through the Remote host interface
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to upgrade the firmware
Authentication using *HostCommAdminKey* is required to run sensitive instructions

register.note: Whatever the settings in bits 5-4 of bytes 1 and 2, the registers holding the two passwords (`02FE` and `02FF`) can never be read back, and the [Inventory](../Inventory) and [License](../License) registers (`0200` to `020F`) are always readable. When the "Protect admin key and sensitive registers" bit in bytes 1 (Local) and 2 (Remote) is set, the *HostCommAdminKey* and the registers 02F0 to 02FF (including this Access Conditions register itself) can be changed only after an authentication using *HostCommAdminKey*. If this bit is not set, they are treated as all other configuration entries.

register.title: Failed authentication counters
register.description: Protect the product against brute-force attacks

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User password in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the Admin authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: Admin
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

field.title: Counter to lock the User authentication key in case of repeated authentication failures
field.name: User
field.remark: Set to 0 to disable password locking

register.title: Options for Master Card and Config push
register.description: TBD

field.title: Options for Master Card and Config push

register.title: Key ID key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the Key ID that identifies the key-set. The same Key ID is used for Config push.

field.title: Key ID key for Master Card and Config push

register.title: AES auth key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the AES key that protects the data on the card. The same AES key is used for Config push.

field.title: AES auth key for Master Card and Config push

register.title: ECC public key for Master Card and Config push
register.description: Master Cards are protected by a key-set, combining AES keys to read the Master Card, and an ECC key-pair to prove the authenticity of its content. This register stores the public part of the ECC key-pair. The same public key is used for Config push.

field.title: ECC public key for Master Card and Config push
Index of the product's private key in the ATECC
field.name: Private key index

node.title: Configuration of the Contactless (NFC) interface in poller (reader) mode

register.title: General configuration of the Contactless (NFC) interface in poller (reader) mode
register.description: Select how the 13.56MHz interface behaves.

field.title: Prevent carrier collision (probe the RF field before becoming active)
field.name: Probe

option.title: Aggressive (be a poller approx 80% of the time)
Fast (be a poller approx 50% of the time)
Intermediate (be a poller approx 25% of the time)
Power saving (be a poller approx 10% of the time)

register.title: NFC / RFID HF protocols enabled in PC/SC mode
register.description: Select the 13.56MHz protocols that the product is looking for.
register.remark: * Disabling the unwanted protocols speeds up the card detection (polling loop) and decreases the average power consumption. * Default value is NFC A+B+F+V (ISO/IEC 14443 A+B, X6319-4, ISO/IEC 15693) plus Innovatron, Inside Pico, ST SR, ACK CTS. Don't forget to activate the protocol(s) you want. * This register is not used in Smart Reader mode (the list of Protocols is constructed according to the Templates).

field.title: NFC / RFID HF protocols enabled in PC/SC mode
field.name: CCID Protocols
field.description: Select the 13.56MHz protocols that the product is looking for.
field.remark: * Disabling the unwanted protocols speeds up the card detection (polling loop) and decreases the average power consumption. * Default value is NFC A+B+F+V (ISO/IEC 14443 A+B, X6319-4, ISO/IEC 15693) plus Innovatron, Inside Pico, ST SR, ACK CTS. Don't forget to activate the protocol(s) you want. * This register is not used in Smart Reader mode (the list of Protocols is constructed according to the Templates).

option.title: Inside Pico family using vicinity protocol (based on ISO/IEC 15693)
NFC-F (JIS X6319-4 and ISO/IEC 18092 at 212 or 424kbit/s)
NFC Forum Type 1 Tags (Broadcomm / Innovision Jewel)
ST MicroElectronics SR contactless tickets (based on ISO/IEC 14443-2B)
Inside Pico family using proximity protocol (based on ISO/IEC 14443-2B)

register.title: NFC / RFID HF bit-rates in PC/SC mode
register.remark: * Forcing the reader to use low-speed protocol increase the operating distance, makes the communication with the card more reliable, and decreases the power consumption. * This register is not used in Smart Reader mode (only lowest-speed protocol are used then).

register.title: Protocol level in PC/SC mode
register.description: Defines whether the Contactless smart-cards or NFC peers are activated up to the highest protocol level.
register.remark: This register is not used in Smart Reader mode (the Templates define how the cards are operated).

field.title: Prevent targets using the NFC-F protocol to enter NFC DEP level
field.name: No NFC DEP F

option.title: NFC-F targets are activated according to ISO 18092 (DEQ_REQ)
NFC-F targets are kept at Felica read/write level

field.title: Prevent targets using the NFC-A protocol to enter NFC DEP level
field.name: No NFC DEP A

option.title: NFC-A targets are activated according to ISO 18092 (DEQ_REQ)
NFC-A targets are kept at ISO 14443 level 3

field.title: Prevent cards using the NFC-B protocol to enter T=CL / ISO DEP level
field.name: No ISO DEP B

option.title: NFC-B cards are activated at ISO 14443 level 4 (ATTRIB)
NFC-B cards are kept at ISO 14443 level 3

field.title: Prevent cards using the NFC-A protocol to enter T=CL / ISO DEP level
field.name: No ISO DEP A

option.title: NFC-A cards are activated at ISO 14443 level 4 (RATS)
NFC-A cards are kept at ISO 14443 level 3

register.title: Contactless ATR rules
register.description: Contactless cards don't have an ATR. PC/SC specifies how a pseudo-ATR shall be constructed by the reader, with a few options.

field.title: Use Innovatron T=0 ATR
field.name: Innovatron T0 ATR
field.description: Innovatron Contactless cards return their T=0 ATR over interface (APGEN/REPGEN). Some legacy applications rely on this ATR to recognize the card, which is different from the PC/SC-specified ATR.
field.remark: Using this option is known to break the compatibility with some implementations of the PC/SC stack (the card has a T=0 ATR but uses T=1 Case 4 APDUs, which is considered as a protocol violation by the stack).

option.title: Obey to PC/SC rule and construct a T=1 ATR, even for Innovatron Contactless cards
For Innovatron Contactless cards, use the T=0 ATR supplied by the card

field.title: Control which values for NN are used in the ATR
field.name: Standard NN only
field.remark: The PC/SC workgroup maintains a list of Contactless memory cards, and defines a NN value for every registered card technology. Unfortunately, this list is not updated frequently and not exhaustive. The reader shall theoritically return NN=`0000` for all the cards that are not in list, but, to help application developers discriminate among card technologies, SpringCard readers have a more complete list (non-PC/SC values being above `F000`).

option.title: Use all NN entries defined by SpringCard to cover all Contactless memory cards
Use only NN entries specified by PC/SC workgroup, return NN=0000 for non-PC/SC cards

register.title: NFC / RFID HF compliance in poller mode
register.description: Configure the contactless interface to comply with various standards.

field.title: Comply with a specific subset of RF standards
field.name: Standard

field.title: NFC Forum polling: bail-out after NFC-A response
field.name: Bail-out

field.title: Control whether NFC-A uses Apple VAS Enhanced Contactless Polling
field.name: Apple VAS ECP

field.title: NFC Forum polling: bail-out after NFC-B response
field.name: Bail-out

field.title: Control whether NFC-B uses extended ATQB or not
field.name: Extended ATQB

field.title: AFI for NFC-B polling
field.name: AFI
field.description: The AFI (Application Family IDentifier) is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-B REQB/WUPB polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified Application Family remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `00` to target all cards (default)

field.title: NFC Forum polling: bail-out after NFC-F response
field.name: Bail-out

field.title: System Code for NFC-F polling
field.name: System Code
field.description: The System Code is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-F polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified System remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `FFFF` to target all cards (default)

field.title: Request Code for NFC-F polling
field.name: Request Code
field.remark: Set to `01` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: Service Code used by READ BINARY with NFC-F cards
field.name: Read Service
field.description: For NFC-F cards, the reader's APDU Interpreter has to translate the ISO/IEC 7816-4 READ BINARY INStruction into a command that is understandable by the target FeliCa card. The Service Code to be used depends on the card's application and configuration.
field.remark: Set to `000B` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: Service Code used by UPDATE BINARY with NFC-F cards
field.name: Write Service
field.description: For NFC-F cards, the reader's APDU Interpreter has to translate the ISO/IEC 7816-4 UPDATE BINARY INStruction into a command that is understandable by the target FeliCa card. The Service Code to be used depends on the card's application and configuration.
field.remark: Set to `0009` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: AFI for NFC-V polling
field.name: AFI
field.description: The AFI (Application Family IDentifier) is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-V polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified Application Family remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `00` to target all cards (default)

field.title: Min. polling interval (10th of second)
field.name: Poll interval
field.description: Use this parameter to slow down the reader (this is the first step to reduce average power consumption).
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader operates at maximum speed.

field.title: Min. time before restarting polling after card removal (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after poll
field.description: Use this parameter if the host system is unable to handle a new card immediately after the previous one.
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader doesn't add a pause after a card removal.

field.title: Shutdown RF if a card remains in the field during a long time (seconds)
field.name: Protect card
field.description: Use this parameter to prevent a card from overheating (and maybe being destroyed) if it stays in the RF field for a long time.
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader never stops the RF field while a card is present.

field.title: Defines test signal to be provided on AUX2
field.name: aux2

field.title: Defines test signal to be provided on AUX1
field.name: aux1

register.title: BLE Tx power
register.description: TX power in 0.1dBm steps

field.title: BLE minimal interval
field.name: MinInterval
field.description: Minimum value for the connection event interval. This must be set be less than or equal to max_interval.

field.title: BLE minimal interval
field.name: MaxInterval
field.description: Maximum value for the connection event interval. This must be set greater than or equal to min_interval.

field.title: BLE slave latency
field.name: SlaveLatency
field.description: This parameter defines how many connection intervals the slave can skip if it has no data to send.

field.title: BLE supervision timeout
field.name: SupervisionTimeout
field.description: The supervision timeout defines for how long the BLE connection is maintained despite the peers being unable to communicate at the currently configured connection interval.

register.title: Notifications Registration Timeout
register.description: The client must register to notifications/indication before this timeout occurs. If not the client will be disconnected. Defaults to 30s.

register.title: Extra options
register.description: Extra BLE options

register.title: Channel map for Sets 0 (application) and 1 (beacon)
register.description: Channels used while advertising.

register.title: iBeacon ID
register.description: Major ID and Minor ID used for iBeacon broadcasting

register.title: Configuration of the main smartcard slot (ID-1)

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Configuration of the first ID-000 slot ("SAM A")

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Configuration of the other ID-000 slots ("SAM B", "SAM C" and "SAM D")

option.title: Class A or Class B (5V or 3.3V)
Class B or Class C (3.3V or 1.8V)
Class A or Class B or Class C (5V, 3.3V or 1.8V)

register.title: Default value for some ATR bytes
Fine tuning of the T=0 timings

field.title: Total timeout for T=0 APDUs (in seconds)
field.name: Timeout
field.remark: Set to 00 to disable this timeout

register.title: Fine tuning of the T=1 timings

field.title: Total timeout for T=1 APDUs (in seconds)
field.name: Timeout
field.remark: Set to 00 to disable this timeout

option.title: Perform GET RESPONSE automatically after SW=61XX

field.title: CLA of the GET RESPONSE command
field.name: GET RESPONSE CLA
field.remark: Set to FF to use the same as the current APDU's. Default 00 is mandatory for EMV compliance.

register.title: Misc. options for the smartcard slots

field.title: Correct wrong length or LRC in ATR
field.name: atr_correct_len_lrc

option.title: Correct invalid ATRs (ensure compliance with PC/SC driver prior 20.10)

field.title: Mask RFU TA1 values in ATR
field.name: atr_mask_rfu_ta1

option.title: Replace RFU TA1 values in ATR (ensure compliance with PC/SC driver prior 20.10)

register.title: Which PC/SC slots are announced to the computer

field.title: Expose the SAM AV through PC/SC
field.name: SAM AV

option.title: The SAM AV is used only internally
The SAM AV has its own PC/SC slot (USE WITH CARE)

field.title: Disable the other SAM slots ("SAM B", "SAM C" and "SAM D")
field.name: No SAM B-C-D

option.title: The other SAM slots are enabled
The other SAM slots are disabled

field.title: Disable the first SAM slot ("SAM" or "SAM A")
field.name: No SAM A

field.title: Disable the second Contact slot ("Contact B")
field.name: No Contact B

field.title: Disable the first Contact slot ("Contact" or "Contact A")
field.name: No Contact A

register.title: Options to control how the slots are named, and their order of enumeration

field.title: How are the slot numbers created
field.name: Order

field.title: Add a part of the device identification data into the names of the slots
field.name: Add device id

option.title: Do not add a device id
Add the complete serial number (in hex)
Add the last 2 bytes of the serial number (in hex)
Add the IPv4 address (if the device as a network interface)

field.title: Force a letter in the name of the SAM slots (eg "SAM A", "SAM B" etc)
field.name: Force SAM index

option.title: No letter for a single SAM ("SAM" only)
Even a single SAM is named "SAM A"

field.title: Force a letter in the name of the ID-1 slots (eg "Contact A", "Contact B" etc)
field.name: Force ID-1 index

option.title: No letter for a single Contact slot ("Contact" only)
Even a single Contact slot is named "Contact A"

field.title: Method for CCID Time Extension (empty) data-blocks
field.name: Time Extension mode
field.remark: The Time Extension frames are mandatory with the CCID driver from the PC/SC-Lite project.

option.title: Send a Time Extension frame when the card has sent a WTX or a 60 procedure byte
Send a Time Extension frame every 1s
Send a Time Extension frame every 2s
Disable sending the Time Extension frame

field.title: Implement CCID without the Interrupt endpoint
field.name: Disable Interrupt EP
field.remark: The Interrupt EP is mandatory with Windows PC/SC driver and most SpringCard-supplied CCID implementations. It shall be disabled only when the product is used with a legacy CCID driver that has a bogus Interrupt implementation.

field.title: Hide CCID class in the USB descriptor
field.name: Hide CCID on USB

option.title: The USB class of the CCID interface is 0B (SmartCard)
The USB class of the CCID interface is FF (vendor specific)

field.title: Time to wait before CCID operation after the SET_CONFIGURATION control (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after start

field.title: Time to wait before CCID operation after the first GET_STATUS request (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after probe

register.title: Class of the embedded APDU interpreter
register.description: A PC/SC reader features an APDU interpreter to expose wired-logic, memory-only cards as if they were compliant with ISO/IEC 7816-4. The PC/SC specification mandates that the interpreter handles C-APDU coming with CLA=`FF`. This register allows to change this value. Setting it to `00` totally disables the product's embedded APDU interpreter.

field.title: Class of the embedded APDU interpreter

node.title: Configuration of the NFC interface in listener mode

register.title: Listener options
register.remark: Listener mode is enabled or disabled in the [Contactless 'General' register](../Contactless/General).

field.title: Be a NFC Tag on startup
field.name: Start as Tag

option.title: NFC Tag emulation must be started by software
NFC Tag emulation is immediately active on startup

register.title: Global Bytes for peer-to-peer communication
register.description: Global Bytes transmitted in NFC ATR_REQ or ATR_RES when a ISO/IEC 18092 peer is found.

register.title: Answer to Select in NFC Tag emulation mode

field.title: Answer to Select in NFC Tag emulation mode

register.title: NDEF message in NFC Tag emulation mode

field.title: NDEF message in NFC Tag emulation mode
